caption:
If you're looking for an affordable crab feast during this 'Circuit Breaker' period, Hotpot Dynasty has got you covered!
.
With minimum spending of S$30 on other zi char dishes, you can now enjoy their 'Circuit Breaker' promotion at S$39.90 for three crabs, which are also available for takeaway orders.
.
What's stopping you from delighting in this local staple and deliciously scrumptious treat?
.
The Chilli Crab at Hotpot Dynasty is intensely flavourful, savoury and slightly piquant; striking all the right chords for me. Try it for yourself and you'll know I'm not kidding! ~ @jerm_tard

caption:
[GIVEAWAY] There is no better news than hearing that KFC's Zinger Double Down has returned to us and even better, it's back with a twist. Presenting: the Mozzarella Zinger Double Down that features the same tantalising Zinger fillets but this time with a chunky, golden mozzarella patty in between. That's not all, these Zinger fillets are slathered with a tangy tomato basil sauce that cuts the richness of the mozzarella patty so you won't be too overwhelmed when you are feasting on this beauty. KFC's Mozzarella Zinger Double Down truly pushed the envelope on what a conventional burger can be.
.
KFC is having a giveaway where you can stand to win a free Double Down Meal delivered to your doorstep. All you have to do is to tag a friend and leave a comment on why you love this fantastic burger! Good luck and happy feasting!
.
Here’s how to win:
.
1. Like our post
2. Follow and like @sethluicious and @kfc_sg 
3. Leave a comment telling us why you love the KFC Double Down Burger, and tag a friend! Use the hashtag #SLxKFC.
****
.
Giveaway ends on 22 June 2020 at 11.59pm. Winner will be announced on 23 June 2020 at 11am. Stay tuned to see if you have won. All the best!
.
Terms and conditions:
.
- Your entry will qualify only if the requirements from above are met.
.
- Your account must be public.
.
- Giveaway is only valid for people residing in Singapore.

caption:
Pizza is one of those comfort food that never fails to cheer me up. Cheesy, savoury bites of piping hot Italian goodness - mmm. And in the midst of the current pandemic, I’m sure we can all do with a little more happiness in our lives.

Today’s recipe calls for bread, lots of cheese, and some creativity, and just 30 minutes of your time. I went for the classic Hawaiian, with well-caramelised pineapple chunks, a generous amount of ham, topped with lots of cheese and tomato sauce.

Of course, for those of you who are more creative, you can come up with even more innovative pizza toppings. Curry chicken? Thai basil pork? You can put almost anything on this DIY bread pizza. Let us know what creative twists you come up with! ~ @colourmeamused

caption:
The omu rice is a simple, hearty dish that’s super versatile - aside from the rice and eggs, you can really add in any ingredient you’d like to spice things up. Since most of us can’t be away from the laptop for too long, today’s Japanese Omu Fried Rice will take only 15 minutes to make! Plus, it feeds the whole family.
.
When I say this is a versatile dish, I mean it. You can add minced meat to the fried rice, or switch out the veggies. Not a fan of green bell peppers? Add carrots for bright, bold colours, or even swap it out for cheese, to add a gooey, creamy texture. The possibilities are endless!
.
If you try out this Japanese Omu Fried Rice recipe, let know how it goes! What did you add to your version of it? ~ @colourmeamused

caption:
AJ Delights at Alexandra Food Village is certainly giving high-end bakeries a run for their money. This gem of a hawker stall has been serving up freshly-baked muffins for eight years.
.
Run by a husband-and-wife team, expect flavours such as the ever-popular Apple Streusel Muffin (S$2.50) with a crumbly, buttery top and a fragrant, light-as-air vanilla muffin.
.
Or if you want something a little more indulgent then the Double Chocolat Muffin (S$2) will make all the calories worth it.
.
All you have to do is place an order for AJ Delights' muffins on their website and you'll have one of these boxes in your hands soon enough! ~ @bunny2302

caption:

.
Loaded with scrumptious toppings, I could already tell they would go extremely well with the soft, fluffy potato. What’s your favourite midday snack? ~ @stercei

caption:
With the current circumstances, you might not be able to go café-hopping just yet, but you can bring @littlefarms into your home.
.
From breakfast goodies to sharing sets perfect for the whole household, there’s something for everyone here. I really enjoyed the Chicken & Avocado Sourdough (S$14), a hefty sandwich packed with flavour.
.
Sandwiched between two thick slices of fluffy, chewy sourdough, the cheese, tomato and chicken came together beautifully on the palate. Think: savoury, piquant notes, complete with the creamy mouthfeel of melted cheese.
.
A drizzle of honey mustard completed it, adding a zing to this really filling sandwich. I’m not kidding when I say I could’ve split this into breakfast and lunch!
.
Little Farms Café also serves up other breakfast dishes like the Ham & Cheese Croissant, Spinach, Mushroom & Goat Feta Quiche. If you’re ordering for the family, sharing sets like Rotisserie Cajun Chicken Family Set – it comes with a whole roasted chicken!
.
Little Farms Café offers island-wide delivery of café-quality dishes, all made with the highest quality produce. With a minimum order of S$30 and free delivery for orders over S$100, you can indulge in a lovely meal with your family. #sp ~ @colourmeamused

caption:
If you are missing your favourite Sunday brunch meals, well don't fret - @threesacrowdcafe might help tide you over till the Circuit Breaker ends. With nostalgic and familiar flavours, your sweet tooth will certainly be satisfied.
.
One of the waffles to look forward to would certainly have to be the Horlick Waffles (S$9) that's covered with a shower of almond crunch and a dusting of malty Horlicks powder. Crisp on the outside and pillowy in the centre, these waffles looked as good as they taste!
.
No waffles are complete without scoops of ice cream, and Three's A Crowd is known for its unique and special flavours. Their Legacy (S$4.50) is a dark chocolate ice cream that's also a tribute to the late Mr Lee Kuan Yew.
.
Three's A Crowd offers pick-up and delivery, so remember to #tapauplease if you would like a little reminder of Sunday brunch! ~ @bunny2302

caption:
Much as I enjoy tinkering about the kitchen, some days I’d love to take a break from cooking and just dig into a feast. And with @alpinespringcatering, I get to do just that.
.
Can you believe that for just S$68, you can enjoy this sumptuous spread from the Zi Char menu for 5 pax? I have to admit, my family ended up saving the leftovers for dinner too – there was just so much delicious food!
.
The Zi Char menu features staples like Braised Ee Fu Noodles with Baby Abalone and Wok Fried White Pepper Clams, and more unconventional dishes like Signature Salted Egg Yolk Beancurd.
.
But my favourite has got to be our local signature dish, the Chilli Crab (add-on S$15). Drenched in a thick, rich chilli crab sauce that has egg strands in it, this was a massive crab. The crab claws are cracked beforehand, so it’s simply a matter of scooping out the sweet, juicy crabmeat. Truly, the star of the show.
.
If you’re feeling hungry, drop a WhatsApp message to +65 9828 3280 for same-day delivery within 3 hours. Yes, it’s that simple. Order away, and dig in! #sp ~ @colourmeamused

caption:
Located at Suntec City, @supersubsingapore first opened its doors to the public in September 2019. The subs came in cardboard boxes which reminded me of those you might spot at a food festival. Each sub came with a side of plain nachos, in case you want to dip into the bountiful toppings sitting atop your sub.
.
Super Sub had a plethora of gourmet options, and I decided to try some of their more famous toppings. Super Sub’s Fiery Chic Bolognese (S$7.80) is one of their best-sellers, and for good reason. Topped with lettuce, cherry tomatoes, jalapeno, mayonnaise and cheddar cheese, this tomato-based sub may look rather unassuming at first glance as compared to the others.
.
However, this turned out to be my favourite. The slightly spicy meat sauce was absolutely delicious and it went extremely well with the chicken hotdog. Have you tried hotdog subs in Singapore? ~ @stercei

caption:
For those of us who want a taste of that idyllic English tea life, here’s an easy recipe for scones worthy of a posh tea time. This 3-Ingredient Scones uses just three ingredients including Sprite (!), and you can make it under 30 minutes!
.
Add a dollop of cream, and a generous serving of jam – you’ve got bakes for a lovely afternoon tea. Don’t forget to brew a pot of piping hot tea to complete the picture. Fluffy and chewy with a crisp top, these scones were lovely indeed.
.
Don’t believe that scones can be made with just 3 ingredients? Try it out, and let us know how your scones turn out! ~ @colourmeamused

caption:
Here’s a quick and easy way to pack more cheesy goodness into your instant noodles meal - Cheesy Garlic Instant Noodles.
.
I’ve opted to top the dish with some chopped chilli for a bit of heat, and even more cheese, though you can definitely swap it out for other garnishes you prefer. It only takes 10 minutes, so it’s great for a #StayHome lunch on a busy workday.
.
The best part about this recipe is that you can adjust the ingredient quantities according to your preference. Can’t get enough of garlic? Add a few more cloves, or cook them whole instead of chopping them - you’ll get creamy roasted cloves that are absolutely delectable.
.
Would you try this recipe, and what would you add? ~ @colourmeamused

caption:
Love pizza but don’t want to get your hands dirty? Try some Pepperoni Pizza Bites - they’ve been proven to be loved by all.
.
A cross between a bagel bite and a pizza muffin, they’re relatively simple to make and only require five minutes of preparation time. Served alongside some marinara sauce, these Pizza Pepperoni Bites are sure to satisfy any pizza cravings you or your family might have.
.
Try our easy-peasy recipe for these delightful snacks today! ~ @stercei

caption:
Anybody craving some Taiwanese food and a refreshing cup of bubble tea? You can now indulge in the best of both worlds with @emosnackssg. Located at Geylang Road, this eatery boasts a myriad of authentic Taiwanese dishes.
.
If you love heat and you're not afraid to chow down on some dangerously spicy food, dive right into their Mala Chicken (S$4.50). Trust me, you'll be hooked on this tasty and feisty dish. Simple, yet incredibly comforting, relive your memories in Taiwan with their delectable dishes.
.
Be sure to #tapauplease as they are currently offering a 20% discount for self pick-up orders and free islandwide delivery for a minimum purchase of S$55! ~@jermtard

caption:
‘Circuit Breaker’ got you feeling down? Turn that frown upside down with yummy fuss-free meals, courtesy of @onandondiners.
.
If you’re too busy to cook or you’d like to treat your family to a scrumptious spread, On & On Diners is here for you with 7 dishes for S$68. Including zi char favourites like Thai Style Mango Fish, Prawn Paste Chicken, and more, the highlight of the set had to be the all-new Signature Seafood Crab Bee Hoon Soup (add-on S$29.90).
.
Packed with a bounty of fresh seafood such as plump clams, succulent prawns and a huge crab with savoury roe, this is the dish for seafood lovers. I particularly enjoyed the rich, flavourful soup, which went really well with the springy beehoon.
.
Sweet crabmeat, creamy and savoury roe, juicy prawns – what more could you ask for? Treat yourselves, and place your orders at +65 6570 9939! #sp ~ @colourmeamused

caption:
Your dining experience at @omotesingapore will not be complete without trying one of their renowned chirashi don.
.
I tried their newest addition, the Umami Soy Chirashi (S$17.80) and I’m loving every bit of this umami filled goodness. With the reddish-orange balls of huge salmon roe scattered amongst the diced sashimi, the bowl was a playground of texture and flavours, waiting to be devoured! - @fel_z

caption:
Today, we’re trying out a crowd-favourite recipe that we found on @shermainexk Instagram post. It’s easy, flaky, and super addictive - this Easy Air Fryer Egg Tarts recipe will have you lining your Tupperware with egg custard pastries for days.
.
I used brown sugar instead of regular white sugar, and the resulting egg tarts had a good amount of caramel smokiness to them. Using frozen prata to replace the typical shortcrust tart shell is certainly a stroke of genius, because it reduces the preparation time by a lot.
.
This recipe makes egg tarts that are closer in taste and texture to Portuguese egg tarts, with a flaky, crispy crust and smooth, egg custard centre. If you have an air fryer at home, pick up a pack of frozen prata from the supermarket and try out this simple recipe. Share your experience with us! ~ @colourmeamused

caption:
Hidden away at Forum Galleria Orchard Road, @brownbutter.sg sits comfortably between its cousin restaurants, Hana Japanese Restaurant and The Benjamin Browns. Of course, I had to try Brown Butter’s insta-famous desserts. Shaped cheekily like a cartoon block of cheese, I loved the attention to detail with the little holes on the Lemon Cheesecake.
.
Priced at S$8.90+, I felt that it was a little exorbitant for a small slice of cake. The difference between these cakes and other cheesecakes is easily spotted.
.
Instead of having a crunchy biscuit base attached to the cake, these cakes came without a base and sat atop biscuits crumbs scattered in an artfully careless manner. Have you tried the desserts at Brown Butter Cafe yet? ~ @stercei

caption:
[CLOSED] Here’s a little something to spice up your life. @kebabsfaktory  brings us an all-new flavour: Mala Kebabs. From 29 June 2020, you can turn any kebab into a sizzling hot mala kebab.
.
The Mala Lamb Shawarma was exceptionally fiery – together with the juicy, gamey lamb meat, the tongue-tingling mala spices made me break out in a sweat. You can also get these mala flavours in their Signature Rolls, Salads and Rice Boxes.
.
And for 5 lucky winners, we’ll be giving away S$20 vouchers so that you can enjoy this all-new mala sensation for yourself!
****
Here’s how to win: 
1. Like our post.
2. Follow @sethluicious and @kebabsfaktory 
3. Comment why you’d like to win the vouchers.
4. Tag a friend!
****
Giveaway ends at 11.59pm on 1 July 2020. Winner will be announced the following day (2 July 2020) at 11am. Stay tuned to see if you have won. All the best!

Feeling in need of something comforting and soothing? Warm yourself up with a piping bowl of frog leg porridge!
.
Fight off the gloom with the sizzling fragrance of tender frog legs immersed in silky, warm porridge. Apart from their immensely comforting congee, @g7liveseafood offers seafood delights and a myriad of zi char dishes.
.
The Marmite Pork Ribs also deserves a mention; crispy ribs coated in a thick sticky, sweet and savoury glaze make this side dish an unbeatable choice. ~ @jermtard

caption:
If you're a fan of pandan cake, good news for you. This soft and fluffy chiffon cake recipe is straight up your alley.
.
Try out our Easy Peasy Pandan Cake recipe, which boasts fluffy and spongy texture. This aromatic cake is my family's all-time favourite dessert. Eat it as an afternoon tea snack or a post-dinner dessert and I'm sure that each mouthful would undoubtedly satisfy your heart and your sweet tooth. ~@jermtard

caption:
Amongst the variety of Malaysian hawker fare at Malaysia Chiak!, my favourite was - hands-down - the Chilly Ban Mian (S$4).
.
Cooked till al dente, the noodles had a nice chewy texture which was perfect when mixed with the minced meat paste, stewed mushrooms and soft boiled egg! ~ @fel_z

caption:
I think you have to agree that there is nothing better than ice cream. Rain or shine, a pint of ice cream is always welcome.
.
This effortless 3-ingredient recipe promises ice cream that's just as good as what you get in the store. I was pretty impressed with how thick, creamy and rich this ice cream turned out - and all without an ice cream maker.
.
Not to mention, the speculoos with its caramel notes was just the icing on the cake - a dream for all the sweet tooths out there. This recipe is so simple and customisable that you can make essentially make any flavour you like.
.
The world is your ice cream flavour, so try this recipe out and tell us what you would make your ice cream with! ~ @bunny2302

caption:
Nestled under a block of flats in the quiet estate of Pandan Gardens is @ahhuateochewnoodle.
.
Helmed by a father-daughter team, this is unlike your usual Teochew fishball noodles. Their speciality Homemade Fuzhou Fishball With Rice Needle Noodles (S$3) might be a tad monochromatic but packs huge flavour.
.
Served with rice needle noodles (more commonly known as lao shu fen), a medley of springy fishballs, prized herh kiao and a couple of Ah Hua Teochew Fishball Noodle unique creations, I was slurping every last bit of these noodles.
.
Though not located in the most accessible place, I have to say that Ah Hua Teochew Fishball Noodle will make it worth your while. ~@bunny2302

Think correction may be needed or else they will be hounded for Fuzhou balls! And I cannot call him ‘Teochew Hero潮州英雄’!😂😂']

caption:
When staying at home for an extended period of time gets you down, I'm sure you're like me and seek comfort in food. @thecommunalplace Pancake Tower (S$16) will put a smile on your face instantly with its three-layered fluffy goodness that comes with maple syrup and a generous scattering of cookie crumbles, blueberries, and strawberries.
.
They are thick, and airy, with just the right amount of sweetness, so you won't feel the need to drizzle too much maple syrup just to enjoy it! If you haven't tried them yet, order today with their islandwide delivery service and current 2-for-1 promotion. ~ @waniology

caption:
Beo Crescent Hainanese Curry Rice puts all other Hainanese curry rice stalls to shame. A luscious and satisfying curry that's messily ladled over a plate of rice, this hits the spot alright. It's a little thinner than most curry dishes but twice as good.
.
Another item that you have to get on your plate is Beo Crescent Hainanese Curry Rice's Crispy Pork. These moreish rashers are crispy to a fault and dangerously addictive, providing a delightful savoury crunch to pair with your rice.
.
Besides the Crispy Pork, Beo Crescent Hainanese Curry also has fantastic meat and vegetable selections that are just as good! At an affordable price point, No Name Hainanese Curry Rice surely lives up to its name, or lack thereof. ~@ bunny2302

caption:
Dalgona coffee is a bonafide hit of 2020; even more so with its fluffy and velvety smooth texture. This time, we'll be taking things up a notch. Inspired by the viral drink, we have made a no-churn version of Dalgona-inspired Ice Cream loaded with delicious toffee bits. .
A memorable treat you won't soon forget, this combination is a match made in heaven. Rich, creamy and decadent, the ice cream melts in your mouth with mellow sweetness and a deep coffee flavour.
.
Coupled with a hint of caramel crunchiness from the toffee bits, I'm sure this dessert will "mocha" you crazy! ~ @jermtard

caption:
In the Whampoa Makan Place, there's a gem that is replete with history. @matasohsg dates back to the 1950s, where hawker life was as rustic as it gets.
.
With handmade fishball and meatballs that are made with 100% yellowtail fish, that makes all the difference, trust me. Their Soh Special (S$4.50/S$5.50) is worth the trip down. A wobbly onsen egg, al dente noodles coupled with those springy and bouncy fishballs - it's a perfect meal if I do say so myself. Make the trip down to Whampoa Makan Place and try it out for yourself! ~@bunny2302

caption:
Impress your friends and family with one of @bobthebakerboy’s out-of-the-box cake designs, like this Defying Gravity Floating Beer Can Cake (from S$138). You can add on tiers, change the colour and the brand as well as the flavour of the cake itself, according to your fancy. But most importantly, it’s one of the best-tasting cakes I’ve had in a long time!
.
This one was made with Belgian Chocolate and the layers were moist and soft, without overwhelming the tastebuds. Their cakes are also made with lower sugar, so it’s healthier than your regular store-bought cake. Take it from me, as someone who can’t get enough of cake; this one is a treat you’ll want to take your time to savour! #sp ~@waniology

caption:
@lovehandleburgers isn't just any vegan burger spot; their burgers start from only S$10 and are packed with bold flavours - not something you'd expect from a vegan place.
.
Their Double Cheeseburger (S$17) consists of two layers of Impossible™ patties, two slices of melted vegan cheese, caramelised onions, burger sauce, and pickles. The homemade brioche buns remained exceptionally firm, despite the journey during delivery.
.
Sink your teeth into one of the creations now, as they're available for islandwide delivery with only a S$10 delivery fee! Note that there's S$30 minimum spending. ~ @waniology

caption:
For most of us working professionals, a cup of coffee is never far from our caffeine-dependent hands. As a coffee fiend who can’t do without my daily cuppa, I was delighted to takethe Bootstrap Mix Pack (S$35) from @bootstrapcoldbrewsg for a spin.
.
My favourite drink from the pack had to be the Bootstrap Cold Brew Milk & Manuka Honey. The manuka honey brought out the velvety smooth sweetness in the coffee and milk, and smoothed over most of the bitter edge from the coffee.
.
This is a classic white coffee, but with a twist. Bootstrap Beverages’ signature cold brew comes with creamy 100% fresh milk, and the floral sweetness of organic New Zealand manuka honey - it has natural healing properties!
.
Coffee or tea, Bootstrap Beverages’ cold brewing technique certainly brings out the best in the beans and leaves. Ready for an awesome perk-me-up? #sp ~ @colourmeamused

caption:
In the gleaming white-washed walls of Maxwell Chambers sits @dumplings.ru , a Russian restaurant serving authentic Russian delights that are sure to charm you.
.
Well, if you are a little nervous about diving headfirst into the depth of Russian cuisine don't worry, these colourful dumplings are a wonderful introduction. With robust and tasty filling such as beef, lamb and even potato and bacon, these are simply scrumptious.
.
Perfect for lunch and dinner, you can even dip your toes and order a Ukrainian Borscht (S$8.50) while you're at it. Fusion Dumplings puts on no airs and trust me, you'll find yourself liking Russian food before you know it! ~ @bunny2302

caption:
Out of eggs? You can still make a chocolatey dessert, with this Mayonnaise Chocolate Cake recipe. The thought of putting savoury mayonnaise in sweet chocolate cake might seem really gross to most, but I gave it a try to see how it turns out.
.
This cake is much fluffier, with a decent crumb pattern that made it like a chocolatey sponge cake. It’s a little stickier on the bottom, almost like sticky date pudding.
.
The baking does yield a rather large cake, but you can’t ever have too much chocolate cake, after all. Share the love with your family and friends - and maybe only reveal the secret ingredient to them after they’ve showered you with praises for your baking prowess.
.
If you’re intrigued by this recipe, why not give it a try? Let us know if this strange ingredient substitution works for you too. ~ @colourmeamused

Well it sounds almost like sea salt caramel cake which is an amazing dessert!', '😍', '😍❤️❤️😋💕']

caption:
If you like zi char, then you've probably heard about @kengengkee. A household name, you'll know you're in for a good time when you order from KEK Seafood, so I ordered their Family Set D (S$116) that's good for four to six people.
.
The highlight of the set has to be their signature Moonlight Hor Fun that came with moon-like egg yolks intact when delivered, poised in the middle of the fried noodles. Break the egg and you'll get hor fun covered in a velvety, silky sauce with moreish, fatty slices of lap cheong and lard.
.
Other dishes I would recommend would be the Coffee Ribs and the Salted Egg Prawns. Moreover, KEK Seafood is so generous with their portions you'll have yummy leftovers for days. Order up a feast from KEK Seafood and trust me you won't be disappointed! ~ @bunny2302

caption:
For those with a sweet tooth and can’t resist desserts, you’ve probably been spending your time baking, and indulging in your bakes. Banana bread, sourdough and cookies aside, sometimes you want to treat yourself to something that’s a little more decadent.
.
Try out this recipe for @milosingapore Bread “Tiramisu” that you can make in just 30 minutes!
.
Be generous with the Milo powder, because who doesn’t love that chocolatey, malty goodness? Bonus: adding Milo powder on top creates a brittle, sweet layer. I’d recommend chilling the “tiramisu” in the fridge overnight, to give it a bit more structure. Plus, the soft, chewy texture is more palatable when chilled.
.
If you’re giving this a try, let us know how it goes! What other recipes would you like to see us try? ~ @colourmeamused

caption:
Our favourite @mcdsg may have finally returned to us after a brief hiatus, but some things money still can’t buy. Yes, I’m talking about the seasonal and very much beloved Prosperity Burger from McDonald’s. Well, to save us the heartache of pining for this seasonal burger, here’s a recipe for DIY McDonald’s Prosperity Burger, in just 30 minutes!
.
While the sliced onions are added raw, like how McDonald’s does it, feel free to grill the onions very lightly if that’s your preference. Personally, I find the sharp, pungent bite from raw sliced onions provides an additional dimension to the burger.
.
The sauce was surprisingly close to McDonald’s rendition, albeit a tad saltier and thicker in consistency. Try it out, and let us know if there’s anything you’d change about the recipe! ~ @colourmeamused

caption:
I’m sure we’ve all been ordering more food delivery during this #StayHome period. I know I certainly have – when the food cravings hit, out comes my mobile phone and off I go onto a food delivery app.
.
I have to admit, it’s frustrating when you’re ‘hangry’ and the network connection somehow chooses that moment to glitch. All the dim sum items you’ve added into your cart? Deleted, and now you have to start over again.
.
Even if we don’t order delivery as much since dine-in is available from 19 June onwards, working from home has made me realise how much we rely on fast network connections –and how frustrating it is when glitches happen, like our trippy glitched post yesterday.
.
If you’re tired of slow network connections glitching up your life, #ditchyourglitch and try the #gigaexperience.
.
@gigaexperience's newest, best plan weighs in at 40GB for S$20 with no contract (price reverts to 40GB for S$30 after 12 months). You can rollover your data, so there’s no wastage of unused data! And if you use up your data, simply purchase a data pack – no hidden fees here. Free rollover data, 24/7 support and no hidden fees– say goodbye to glitches, ‘hangry’ outbursts, and hello to Singapore’s fastest network. #sp #giga ~ @colourmeamused

caption:
Those of us who enjoy Asian desserts would be used to sweet potatoes. From sweet potato sesame balls, to bubur cha cha, these starchy roots add lots of chewy bite to our favourite sweet treats.
.
Let’s explore a different side of desserts and sweet treats, with Anthony Bourdain’s Candied Sweet Potatoes with Bourbon.
.
Together with the bourbon sauce, it was an absolute delight. The butter and sugar in the sauce left a creamy mouthfeel, while a hint of tartness from the apple cider played on my palate. The alcohol content from the bourbon and cider would’ve burnt off during the cooking process, so all that’s left of the bourbon was mostly deep notes of caramel, vanilla and molasses.
.
Try it, and let us know how it goes! ~ @colourmemamused

Weighing 170g each, these Copycat @levainbakery Chocolate Chip Walnut Cookies can be a hefty snack!
.
Just like the real deal, the cookies were perfectly crunchy on the outside, yet soft, chewy, and gooey inside.
.
You definitely have to curb that cookie monster in you to avoid overeating these giant cookies! ~ @fel_z

caption:
Some days you don’t want fancy burgers going for S$15 a pop. You just want a no-frills, down-to-earth burger. Patty, bun, condiments; the three most important aspects that make or break a burger.

Craving cheap but good burgers, I was delighted to discover @zippbnp, located at Amoy Street Food Centre.

Starting off strong with the Hamburger (S$5.70/single patty, S$8.70/double patty), this was a burger that I couldn’t wait to sink my teeth into. Even though I got the single patty burger, the 150g handmade patty was already so thick that it took a little effort to fit in my mouth---I can hardly imagine what the double patty would be like!

Zipp Burger & Pasta is truly one of those hidden gems, but now that the cat’s out of the bag, you’ll know where you can get excellent, scrumptious burgers. What’s your go-to spot for burgers? ~ @colourmeamused

caption: Fragrant and fluffy steamed nasi dagang aside, first-timers trying @yes.nasi.kukus should not miss their Signature Fried Chicken (S$4, a la carte order). Juicy and succulent, every inch of the chicken thigh was deep-fried to a glorious golden brown. If you love your spice, enjoy it with their sambal chilli for that extra kick that will leave you wanting more! ~ @fel_z

caption:
Whip up your very own Canadian dish at home during this #StayHome period with our homemade Canadian Poutine recipe!

Using ingredients we can find in Singapore, this is probably as authentic as it gets. Seeing the end product was absolutely satisfying for me because I loved every aspect of the dish. The way the warm, dark, ambrosial gravy trickled down the fries and chunks of cheese whetted my appetite as soon as I poured the gravy over this delightful meal.

I especially liked how the heat of the gravy melted the cheese, making it look appetising and stringy. The fries were cooked to a crisp golden-brown and I was glad I decided to cook them without peeling the potato skin.

Have you tried Canadian poutine before? ~ @stercei

caption:
There's nothing quite like a hearty brunch plate to kickstart the day. Getting your brunch fix need not always break the bank! @lolascafesg is offering free delivery with minimum spending of S$80.

Staying at home means you can have brunch in your pyjamas! Dig into a plate of flaky croissant sandwiched with fluffy scrambled eggs in the comforts of your home.

No more waiting in line, and their wide variety of food options will make your mornings extra special! ~ @jermtard

caption:
What if I told you that you, too, could cook and bake like famous chefs? We may not be able to match his skill in crafting intricate desserts, but at least we can put together this easy yet scrumptious chocolate cake, as seen from @pierrehermeofficial’s Instagram post.

Pierre Hermé’s 5-Ingredient Chocolate Cake recipe is simple enough, and yields an absolutely heavenly cake. Imagine the soft, crumbly texture of butter cookies, but with the rich, decadent bittersweet notes of dark chocolate.

You might even want to pair your chocolate cake with the most classic of accompaniments: vanilla ice cream. Creamy and cold to the warm and crumbly chocolate cake, this is sure to sate even the direst dessert cravings.

If you leave it in the fridge overnight, it gets a lot denser and more fudgey. Mmm, delicious.

Want to feel like a famous pastry chef for a day? Try this 5-Ingredient Chocolate Cake recipe, and share your experience with us! ~ @colourmeamused

caption:
If you're looking for an affordable crab feast during this 'Circuit Breaker' period, Hotpot Dynasty has got you covered!
.
With minimum spending of S$30 on other zi char dishes, you can now enjoy their 'Circuit Breaker' promotion at S$39.90 for three crabs, which are also available for takeaway orders.
.
What's stopping you from delighting in this local staple and deliciously scrumptious treat?
.
The Chilli Crab at Hotpot Dynasty is intensely flavourful, savoury and slightly piquant; striking all the right chords for me. Try it for yourself and you'll know I'm not kidding! ~ @jerm_tard

caption:
[GIVEAWAY] There is no better news than hearing that KFC's Zinger Double Down has returned to us and even better, it's back with a twist. Presenting: the Mozzarella Zinger Double Down that features the same tantalising Zinger fillets but this time with a chunky, golden mozzarella patty in between. That's not all, these Zinger fillets are slathered with a tangy tomato basil sauce that cuts the richness of the mozzarella patty so you won't be too overwhelmed when you are feasting on this beauty. KFC's Mozzarella Zinger Double Down truly pushed the envelope on what a conventional burger can be.
.
KFC is having a giveaway where you can stand to win a free Double Down Meal delivered to your doorstep. All you have to do is to tag a friend and leave a comment on why you love this fantastic burger! Good luck and happy feasting!
.
Here’s how to win:
.
1. Like our post
2. Follow and like @sethluicious and @kfc_sg 
3. Leave a comment telling us why you love the KFC Double Down Burger, and tag a friend! Use the hashtag #SLxKFC.
****
.
Giveaway ends on 22 June 2020 at 11.59pm. Winner will be announced on 23 June 2020 at 11am. Stay tuned to see if you have won. All the best!
.
Terms and conditions:
.
- Your entry will qualify only if the requirements from above are met.
.
- Your account must be public.
.
- Giveaway is only valid for people residing in Singapore.

caption:
Pizza is one of those comfort food that never fails to cheer me up. Cheesy, savoury bites of piping hot Italian goodness - mmm. And in the midst of the current pandemic, I’m sure we can all do with a little more happiness in our lives.

Today’s recipe calls for bread, lots of cheese, and some creativity, and just 30 minutes of your time. I went for the classic Hawaiian, with well-caramelised pineapple chunks, a generous amount of ham, topped with lots of cheese and tomato sauce.

Of course, for those of you who are more creative, you can come up with even more innovative pizza toppings. Curry chicken? Thai basil pork? You can put almost anything on this DIY bread pizza. Let us know what creative twists you come up with! ~ @colourmeamused

caption:
The omu rice is a simple, hearty dish that’s super versatile - aside from the rice and eggs, you can really add in any ingredient you’d like to spice things up. Since most of us can’t be away from the laptop for too long, today’s Japanese Omu Fried Rice will take only 15 minutes to make! Plus, it feeds the whole family.
.
When I say this is a versatile dish, I mean it. You can add minced meat to the fried rice, or switch out the veggies. Not a fan of green bell peppers? Add carrots for bright, bold colours, or even swap it out for cheese, to add a gooey, creamy texture. The possibilities are endless!
.
If you try out this Japanese Omu Fried Rice recipe, let know how it goes! What did you add to your version of it? ~ @colourmeamused

caption:
AJ Delights at Alexandra Food Village is certainly giving high-end bakeries a run for their money. This gem of a hawker stall has been serving up freshly-baked muffins for eight years.
.
Run by a husband-and-wife team, expect flavours such as the ever-popular Apple Streusel Muffin (S$2.50) with a crumbly, buttery top and a fragrant, light-as-air vanilla muffin.
.
Or if you want something a little more indulgent then the Double Chocolat Muffin (S$2) will make all the calories worth it.
.
All you have to do is place an order for AJ Delights' muffins on their website and you'll have one of these boxes in your hands soon enough! ~ @bunny2302

.
Loaded with scrumptious toppings, I could already tell they would go extremely well with the soft, fluffy potato. What’s your favourite midday snack? ~ @stercei

caption:
With the current circumstances, you might not be able to go café-hopping just yet, but you can bring @littlefarms into your home.
.
From breakfast goodies to sharing sets perfect for the whole household, there’s something for everyone here. I really enjoyed the Chicken & Avocado Sourdough (S$14), a hefty sandwich packed with flavour.
.
Sandwiched between two thick slices of fluffy, chewy sourdough, the cheese, tomato and chicken came together beautifully on the palate. Think: savoury, piquant notes, complete with the creamy mouthfeel of melted cheese.
.
A drizzle of honey mustard completed it, adding a zing to this really filling sandwich. I’m not kidding when I say I could’ve split this into breakfast and lunch!
.
Little Farms Café also serves up other breakfast dishes like the Ham & Cheese Croissant, Spinach, Mushroom & Goat Feta Quiche. If you’re ordering for the family, sharing sets like Rotisserie Cajun Chicken Family Set – it comes with a whole roasted chicken!
.
Little Farms Café offers island-wide delivery of café-quality dishes, all made with the highest quality produce. With a minimum order of S$30 and free delivery for orders over S$100, you can indulge in a lovely meal with your family. #sp ~ @colourmeamused

caption:
If you are missing your favourite Sunday brunch meals, well don't fret - @threesacrowdcafe might help tide you over till the Circuit Breaker ends. With nostalgic and familiar flavours, your sweet tooth will certainly be satisfied.
.
One of the waffles to look forward to would certainly have to be the Horlick Waffles (S$9) that's covered with a shower of almond crunch and a dusting of malty Horlicks powder. Crisp on the outside and pillowy in the centre, these waffles looked as good as they taste!
.
No waffles are complete without scoops of ice cream, and Three's A Crowd is known for its unique and special flavours. Their Legacy (S$4.50) is a dark chocolate ice cream that's also a tribute to the late Mr Lee Kuan Yew.
.
Three's A Crowd offers pick-up and delivery, so remember to #tapauplease if you would like a little reminder of Sunday brunch! ~ @bunny2302

caption:
Much as I enjoy tinkering about the kitchen, some days I’d love to take a break from cooking and just dig into a feast. And with @alpinespringcatering, I get to do just that.
.
Can you believe that for just S$68, you can enjoy this sumptuous spread from the Zi Char menu for 5 pax? I have to admit, my family ended up saving the leftovers for dinner too – there was just so much delicious food!
.
The Zi Char menu features staples like Braised Ee Fu Noodles with Baby Abalone and Wok Fried White Pepper Clams, and more unconventional dishes like Signature Salted Egg Yolk Beancurd.
.
But my favourite has got to be our local signature dish, the Chilli Crab (add-on S$15). Drenched in a thick, rich chilli crab sauce that has egg strands in it, this was a massive crab. The crab claws are cracked beforehand, so it’s simply a matter of scooping out the sweet, juicy crabmeat. Truly, the star of the show.
.
If you’re feeling hungry, drop a WhatsApp message to +65 9828 3280 for same-day delivery within 3 hours. Yes, it’s that simple. Order away, and dig in! #sp ~ @colourmeamused

caption:
Located at Suntec City, @supersubsingapore first opened its doors to the public in September 2019. The subs came in cardboard boxes which reminded me of those you might spot at a food festival. Each sub came with a side of plain nachos, in case you want to dip into the bountiful toppings sitting atop your sub.
.
Super Sub had a plethora of gourmet options, and I decided to try some of their more famous toppings. Super Sub’s Fiery Chic Bolognese (S$7.80) is one of their best-sellers, and for good reason. Topped with lettuce, cherry tomatoes, jalapeno, mayonnaise and cheddar cheese, this tomato-based sub may look rather unassuming at first glance as compared to the others.
.
However, this turned out to be my favourite. The slightly spicy meat sauce was absolutely delicious and it went extremely well with the chicken hotdog. Have you tried hotdog subs in Singapore? ~ @stercei

caption:
For those of us who want a taste of that idyllic English tea life, here’s an easy recipe for scones worthy of a posh tea time. This 3-Ingredient Scones uses just three ingredients including Sprite (!), and you can make it under 30 minutes!
.
Add a dollop of cream, and a generous serving of jam – you’ve got bakes for a lovely afternoon tea. Don’t forget to brew a pot of piping hot tea to complete the picture. Fluffy and chewy with a crisp top, these scones were lovely indeed.
.
Don’t believe that scones can be made with just 3 ingredients? Try it out, and let us know how your scones turn out! ~ @colourmeamused

caption:
Here’s a quick and easy way to pack more cheesy goodness into your instant noodles meal - Cheesy Garlic Instant Noodles.
.
I’ve opted to top the dish with some chopped chilli for a bit of heat, and even more cheese, though you can definitely swap it out for other garnishes you prefer. It only takes 10 minutes, so it’s great for a #StayHome lunch on a busy workday.
.
The best part about this recipe is that you can adjust the ingredient quantities according to your preference. Can’t get enough of garlic? Add a few more cloves, or cook them whole instead of chopping them - you’ll get creamy roasted cloves that are absolutely delectable.
.
Would you try this recipe, and what would you add? ~ @colourmeamused

caption:
Love pizza but don’t want to get your hands dirty? Try some Pepperoni Pizza Bites - they’ve been proven to be loved by all.
.
A cross between a bagel bite and a pizza muffin, they’re relatively simple to make and only require five minutes of preparation time. Served alongside some marinara sauce, these Pizza Pepperoni Bites are sure to satisfy any pizza cravings you or your family might have.
.
Try our easy-peasy recipe for these delightful snacks today! ~ @stercei

caption:
Anybody craving some Taiwanese food and a refreshing cup of bubble tea? You can now indulge in the best of both worlds with @emosnackssg. Located at Geylang Road, this eatery boasts a myriad of authentic Taiwanese dishes.
.
If you love heat and you're not afraid to chow down on some dangerously spicy food, dive right into their Mala Chicken (S$4.50). Trust me, you'll be hooked on this tasty and feisty dish. Simple, yet incredibly comforting, relive your memories in Taiwan with their delectable dishes.
.
Be sure to #tapauplease as they are currently offering a 20% discount for self pick-up orders and free islandwide delivery for a minimum purchase of S$55! ~@jermtard

caption:
‘Circuit Breaker’ got you feeling down? Turn that frown upside down with yummy fuss-free meals, courtesy of @onandondiners.
.
If you’re too busy to cook or you’d like to treat your family to a scrumptious spread, On & On Diners is here for you with 7 dishes for S$68. Including zi char favourites like Thai Style Mango Fish, Prawn Paste Chicken, and more, the highlight of the set had to be the all-new Signature Seafood Crab Bee Hoon Soup (add-on S$29.90).
.
Packed with a bounty of fresh seafood such as plump clams, succulent prawns and a huge crab with savoury roe, this is the dish for seafood lovers. I particularly enjoyed the rich, flavourful soup, which went really well with the springy beehoon.
.
Sweet crabmeat, creamy and savoury roe, juicy prawns – what more could you ask for? Treat yourselves, and place your orders at +65 6570 9939! #sp ~ @colourmeamused

caption:
@sunougatsg has launched 4 flavours for their Nougat - the Plain Nougat, Scallion Nougat, Chocolate Lactation Nougats, Rose Lychee Nougat (seasonal) (each bag is $6) with seasonal flavours at $10/bag. Soft, chewy and not too sweet, it's the perfect tea time snack or energy boost to kick start your day!

Free delivery is available to one location for orders above $60. To order, DM @sunougatsg with your preferred quantity, flavour, and delivery address. They will send you a QR code for payment. To confirm your orders, just send them a screenshot of your payment & order details.

caption:
[Lor Bak Mama] - Homecooked goodness from @lorbakmama. Started by Christine Yue who has zero income when she has to closed her nail salons during circuit breaker.
.

I am glad that she is continuing to do this as her braised pork are so yummy, tender and absorbing the delicious flavours of the braising sauce. I think she can do this full time instead.
.
The Lor Bak Set ($40) comes with 
1 卤肉饭 ($10) + 1 卤肉 ($18) + 4 扣肉包 ($12). Every 卤肉饭 comes with Braised Meat, Egg, Tau Kwa & Mushrooms.
.
Pre-order only with islandwide delivery. WhatsApp 86680788 for enquiry and order.

caption:
[Oddle Eats] - Founders of F&B e-commerce platform Oddle have launched @oddleeats - a new personalised food directory featuring over 500 of Oddle’s restaurant partners. Diners can now browse the online platform for a diverse range of food choices from local Singaporean dishes to western cuisine, and click through to land on the restaurant’s page to order directly from them for island-wide delivery, without middlemen or hidden costs. We had the Salted egg yolk custard bun, Mee Suah Kueh and Baked BBQ Pork pastry from Swee Choon, as well as the Original White Bee Hoon from the White Restaurant.

Since 2014, Oddle has brought online ordering systems to thousands of restaurants around the region – onboarding more than 500 new restaurants and F&B groups in Singapore in April 2020 alone. Born of the three co-founders' love for the industry, Oddle makes it easier for restaurants to manage and grow their business through its affordable e-commerce service.

caption:
[Ippudo] - @ippudosg recently launched their new IPPUDO’s DIY Ramen Meal Kits, frozen Japanese gyozas and pork belly chashu! You can whip up your very own Hakata-style ramen in under 20 mins and enjoy it anytime with their convenient Shiromaru Motoaji Ramen Kit ($15.30/pack) and Akamaru Shinaji Ramen Kit ($16.35/pack). Each individually packed ramen kit comes with thin, silky strands of ramen noodles, creamy tonkatsu soup base that has been simmered for 18 hours to achieve its well-loved umami goodness, pork belly chasu slices, and marinated black fungus that can be whipped out in just 17 minutes. The Akamaru DIY Ramen Kit comes with additional IPPUDO's specialty miso paste and fragrant garlic oil to create a moreish bowl with greater depth. 
IPPUDO's  Home Cooking DIY Ramen Meal Kit, and frozen items are available from 13 June 2020, and can be purchased online at www.ippudo.oddle.me or in stores at various IPPUDO Singapore outlets (excluding Marina Bay Sands outlet).

caption:
[Route 65] - For the first time ever, @route65sg is releasing a time limited Bak Chang Burger from 15-30 June in conjunction with Dragon Boat's festival! Bring your Bak Chang up a notch this season with their Pork Bak Chang Rice Burger and the Shoyu Beef Bak Chang Rice Burger, featuring soft and sticky glutinous rice sandwiching flavourful savoury fillings in between. Route 65 Chef Anthony’s mother has been making bak chang and gifting them to her family, neighbours, and friends for over 20 years and even more so during this pandemic. As the nation overcomes the crisis as a collective, Chef Anthony was looking for innovative ways to help tide through Route 65 business, and his mother’s continuous spirit of giving bak chang has inspired him to deconstruct her traditional version into recreating his own contemporary bak chang.
.

Upgrade to a Bak Chang burger set which comes with Black Lemon Tea with Lychee Boba with a top up of $9.90. You can also enjoy 2 free traditional Bak Chang specially handmade by the Chef's mum for orders above $50. Islandwide delivery is available with free delivery for orders above $50, and $5 delivery fee for orders above $30. You may place your order at order.route65sg.com

caption:
[Paradise Dynasty] - @paradisegrpsg has just launched the Fun DIY Xiao Long Bao Kit, so you can savour the Paradise Dynasty's famed steamed dumplings right in the comfort of your home. The convenient kit comes with a bamboo steamer basket, bamboo steamer liner, disposable gloves, pork filling (original flavour) and 2 sets of eight pastry skin made with natural colouring. It's the perfect stay home fun activity to bond with your family, as you can now recreate their signature xiao long bao in just 7 steps! We also had the Prawn & Pork Dumpling in Hot Chilli Vinaigrette, which came in a frozen pack, but is also extremely convenient to prepare by just cooking for 6-7 minutes in boiling water before pouring the hot chilli vinaigrette sauce over the cooked dumplings. You can enjoy free Prawn and Pork Dumpling in Hot Chilli Vinaigrette with orders above $70.
.

You can place your order at: https://paradisedynasty.oddle.me/en_SG/ Enjoy 15% off self-pick up orders made via online orders. Free island-wide delivery is available with orders above $100, and $5 island-wide delivery fees with orders above $50.

caption:
[Route 65] - For the first time ever, @route65sg is releasing a time limited Bak Chang Burger from 15-30 June in conjunction with Dragon Boat's festival! Bring your Bak Chang up a notch this season with their Pork Bak Chang Rice Burger and the Shoyu Beef Bak Chang Rice Burger, featuring soft and sticky glutinous rice sandwiching flavourful savoury fillings in between. Route 65 Chef Anthony’s mother has been making bak chang and gifting them to her family, neighbours, and friends for over 20 years and even more so during this pandemic. As the nation overcomes the crisis as a collective, Chef Anthony was looking for innovative ways to help tide through Route 65 business, and his mother’s continuous spirit of giving bak chang has inspired him to deconstruct her traditional version into recreating his own contemporary bak chang.
.

Upgrade to a Bak Chang burger set which comes with Black Lemon Tea with Lychee Boba with a top up of $9.90. You can also enjoy 2 free traditional Bak Chang specially handmade by the Chef's mum for orders above $50. Islandwide delivery is available with free delivery for orders above $50, and $5 delivery fee for orders above $30. You may place your order at order.route65sg.com

caption:
[Paradise Dynasty] - @paradisegrpsg has just launched the Fun DIY Xiao Long Bao Kit, so you can savour the Paradise Dynasty's famed steamed dumplings right in the comfort of your home. The convenient kit comes with a bamboo steamer basket, bamboo steamer liner, disposable gloves, pork filling (original flavour) and 2 sets of eight pastry skin made with natural colouring. It's the perfect stay home fun activity to bond with your family, as you can now recreate their signature xiao long bao in just 7 steps! We also had the Prawn & Pork Dumpling in Hot Chilli Vinaigrette, which came in a frozen pack, but is also extremely convenient to prepare by just cooking for 6-7 minutes in boiling water before pouring the hot chilli vinaigrette sauce over the cooked dumplings. You can enjoy free Prawn and Pork Dumpling in Hot Chilli Vinaigrette with orders above $70.
.

You can place your order at: https://paradisedynasty.oddle.me/en_SG/ Enjoy 15% off self-pick up orders made via online orders. Free island-wide delivery is available with orders above $100, and $5 island-wide delivery fees with orders above $50.

caption:
[Cat & the Fiddle] - @catandthefiddlecakes welsomes a brand new addition to its line up - the Gula Me Gusta cheesecake (pandan gula melaka cheesecake) to be launched in conjunction with the opening of its latest outlet in Bishan’s Junction 8.
.
The Gula Me Gusta (whole, 900g: $48.90) is the epitome of Cat & the Fiddle’s signature Asian-inspired cheesecake. Reminiscent of the traditional ondeh-ondeh, it features luscious pandan-infused cream cheese sits on a base of sweet and savoury gula melaka sponge cake, topped with a gula melaka glaze as well as a generous sprinkle of grated coconut. Cat & the Fiddle is also pleased to announce that all its cheesecakes are now certified Halal by Majlis Ugama Islam Singapore (MUIS). The perfect tea-time treat for everyone!
.

The Gula Me Gusta cheesecake is now available for purchase online at www.catandthefiddle.com or at its brick-and-mortar outlets located at The Central, Westgate as well as at the new store in Junction 8.

caption:
[🚇 #StormscapeStayHome]
BLUE HARD FOAM LATTE?!
No more Monday blues because today is Tuesday! Making some hard foam latte that won’t overflow! Check out the rising milk foam that won’t spill over!
.
1️⃣ Prepare 1-2 shots of Espresso from the Nespresso machine to yield 40ml of Espresso (I’m using double shots 80ml)
2️⃣ Using Nespresso Aeroccino, pour 100ml of Fresh Milk and butterfly pea water (8 petals steep in 100ml of hot water) and give it a short press to create Hot Milk Foam (Long press for 2s for Cold Milk Foam)
3️⃣ Scoop the Hot Milk Foam onto the espresso shot prepared in 1️⃣
4️⃣ Let the Milk Foam settle for 3 minutes exactly
5️⃣ Pour 100ml of Fresh Milk at one spot in the middle of the cup so that the hardened milk foam will rise evenly
.

ESPRESSO ICE CUBES?!
Starting a brand new week into Phase 2 with a cup of coffee. This is not a video ah haha.
.
Steps
1️⃣ Prepare Espresso Shot (40ml) from the Nespresso machine and freeze it overnight. This is so convenient and saves time to make coffee every morning
2️⃣ Each Nespresso Ice Cube Tray is 30ml so 9 of them requires 270ml of espresso shot
3️⃣ Add your desired number of espresso ice cubes prepared in 1️⃣ into empty glass
4️⃣ Fill up the glass with fresh milk
.

THAI MILK TEA ICE CUBES with MATCHA?!
Celebrating the start of Phase 2 which started yesterday with some colours! Thanks for all the support for my #StormscapeHomeCafe series so far!
.
Steps
1️⃣ Whisk matcha (1g matcha: 100ml hot water)
2️⃣ Prepare Thai Ice Tea Ice Cubes the night before by steeping in hot water
3️⃣ Add the Thai Ice Tea Ice Cubes to the whisked matcha
4️⃣ Pour Fresh Milk over the Thai Ice Tea to create the beautiful multi-coloured layers
.

MONDAY PURPLE?!
Turning all Monday Blues into purple because Monday is over! Adding more ice to my butterfly pea today because of the hot weather! .
Steps
1️⃣ Prepare Butterfly pea by adding 8 petals to 100ml of hot water and seep for 5 mins
2️⃣ Pour the butterfly pea into the ice cube tray and leave it overnight
Fill an entire glass with butterfly pea ice cubes
4️⃣ Fill up 90% of the glass with butterfly pea drink in the same ratio in 1️⃣
5️⃣ Add 10ml of freshly squeezed lemon juice and ta-dah!
.

MILK CARTON GLASS?!
Drinking some milk directly from this milk carton glass with some butterfly pea and a shot of Espresso!
.
Steps
1️⃣ Add ice cubes into empty glass
2️⃣ Prepare Butterfly pea by adding 8 petals to 100ml of hot water and seep for 5 mins
3️⃣ Pour the butterfly pea onto the ice cubes
4️⃣ Pour 100ml of Fresh Milk which will settle as the bottom layer
5️⃣ Add a single shot of espresso (40ml), I’m using @nespresso.sg Barista Creation Creations - Chiaro with a distinctive sweetness and malty taste
.

caption:
[🚇 #StormscapeStayHome]
BLUE HARD FOAM LATTE?!
No more Monday blues because today is Tuesday! Making some hard foam latte that won’t overflow! Check out the rising milk foam that won’t spill over!
.
1️⃣ Prepare 1-2 shots of Espresso from the Nespresso machine to yield 40ml of Espresso (I’m using double shots 80ml)
2️⃣ Using Nespresso Aeroccino, pour 100ml of Fresh Milk and butterfly pea water (8 petals steep in 100ml of hot water) and give it a short press to create Hot Milk Foam (Long press for 2s for Cold Milk Foam)
3️⃣ Scoop the Hot Milk Foam onto the espresso shot prepared in 1️⃣
4️⃣ Let the Milk Foam settle for 3 minutes exactly
5️⃣ Pour 100ml of Fresh Milk at one spot in the middle of the cup so that the hardened milk foam will rise evenly
.

.

4️⃣ Add some condensed milk (optional) if you want to increase the sweetness
.

Tiger Sugar has launched their [NEW] Black Sugar Popcorn (SGD 4.90) 2 days ago! Available at their outlets and on Shopee, I decided to make a matcha drink with popcorn toppings without the need to add sugar since the popcorn is sweet
.

4️⃣ Top up with black sugar popcorn for additional sweetness
.

MATCHA CUBES BROWN SUGAR BLUE PEA LATTE?!
TGIF with a colourful drink filled with Green Matcha ice cubes, Brown sugar and blue pea! Think
.
Steps
1️⃣ Prepare Matcha Ice cubes the night before. 1g Matcha powder: 100ml hot water
2️⃣ Pour 150ml of Fresh Milk onto the Matcha Ice Cubes
3️⃣ Add 8 dried Butterfly pea petals to your glass
4️⃣ Pour 100ml of Hot water and let it seep for 5 mins and filter away the butterfly pea before pouring onto the Fresh Milk in 2️⃣
5️⃣ Add in Brown Sugar Syrup (1g Dark Brown Sugar: 3.5g of Water heated over fire to concentrate it)
.

SAKURA MATCHA LATTE?!
Recreated Starbucks Cherry Blossom Frappe with with the addition of Strawberry and Matcha! Pretty and tasty with the incorporation of many components
.
Steps
1️⃣ Cook FROZEN strawberry: Sugar in the ratio of 3:1 to get the semi-liquid strawberry compote
2️⃣ Add 2 ice cream scoops worth of Strawberry compote into a glass
3️⃣ Fill the glass with Ice Cubes until half full
4️⃣ Add in Strawberry Milk (I’m using the Cherry Blossom Latte from Cafe Coco with additional floral scent) until 80% full
5️⃣ Whisk your matcha to yield 40ml and pour into 4️⃣
.

caption:
[🚇 #StormscapeStayHome]
MONDAY PURPLE?!
Turning all Monday Blues into purple because Monday is over! Adding more ice to my butterfly pea today because of the hot weather! .
Steps
1️⃣ Prepare Butterfly pea by adding 8 petals to 100ml of hot water and seep for 5 mins
2️⃣ Pour the butterfly pea into the ice cube tray and leave it overnight
Fill an entire glass with butterfly pea ice cubes
4️⃣ Fill up 90% of the glass with butterfly pea drink in the same ratio in 1️⃣
5️⃣ Add 10ml of freshly squeezed lemon juice and ta-dah!
.

caption:
[🚇 #StormscapeStayHome]
MILK CARTON GLASS?!
Drinking some milk directly from this milk carton glass with some butterfly pea and a shot of Espresso!
.
Steps
1️⃣ Add ice cubes into empty glass
2️⃣ Prepare Butterfly pea by adding 8 petals to 100ml of hot water and seep for 5 mins
3️⃣ Pour the butterfly pea onto the ice cubes
4️⃣ Pour 100ml of Fresh Milk which will settle as the bottom layer
5️⃣ Add a single shot of espresso (40ml), I’m using @nespresso.sg Barista Creation Creations - Chiaro with a distinctive sweetness and malty taste
.

caption:
[🚇 #StormscapeStayHome]
MATCHA ICE CUBES ESPRESSO?!
Ever since I started using espresso cubes for my drinks, I always wanted to make matcha ice cubes in the form of spheres because they are so therapeutic to watch!
.
Steps
1️⃣ Whisk matcha (1g matcha: 100ml hot water) and freeze it overnight to form ice cubes.
2️⃣ Place the spherical matcha ice cubes into empty glass
3️⃣ Add more ice cubes (optional)
4️⃣ Fill up the glass with fresh milk
5️⃣ Add a single shot of espresso (40ml) for the extra caffeine
.

caption:
[🚇 #StormscapeStayHome]
MATCHA ESPRESSO ICE CUBES?!
The weather is getting really hot lately and since adding ice to coffee usually dilutes it, I decided to freeze the espresso shots to preserve the flavour and intensity with some matcha!
.
Steps
1️⃣ Prepare Espresso Shot (40ml) from the Nespresso machine and freeze it overnight. This is so convenient and saves time to make coffee every morning
2️⃣ Each Nespresso Ice Cube Tray is 30ml so 9 of them requires 270ml of espresso shot
3️⃣ Add your desired number of espresso ice cubes prepared in 1️⃣ into empty glass
4️⃣ Fill up the glass with whisked matcha (1g matcha powder to 100 ml hot water)
5️⃣ I’m using Ceremonial grade Matcha which interestingly turned out sweet when milk is added
6️⃣ Fill up the glass with 150ml of Fresh Milk
.

caption:
[🚇 #StormscapeStayHome]
MATCHA CUBES BROWN SUGAR BLUE PEA LATTE?!
TGIF with a colourful drink filled with Green Matcha ice cubes, Brown sugar and blue pea! Think
.
Steps
1️⃣ Prepare Matcha Ice cubes the night before. 1g Matcha powder: 100ml hot water
2️⃣ Pour 150ml of Fresh Milk onto the Matcha Ice Cubes
3️⃣ Add 8 dried Butterfly pea petals to your glass
4️⃣ Pour 100ml of Hot water and let it seep for 5 mins and filter away the butterfly pea before pouring onto the Fresh Milk in 2️⃣
5️⃣ Add in Brown Sugar Syrup (1g Dark Brown Sugar: 3.5g of Water heated over fire to concentrate it)
.

caption:
[🚇 #StormscapeStayHome]
HARD FOAM LATTE?!
Celebrating World Environment Day (5 June) tomorrow with Nespresso (@Nespresso.SG) who has partnered with National Geographic (@NatGeo) this year in their support for farmers in places such as Uganda, Colombia and Zimbabwe to sustainably source coffee and make a difference which also helps to revive the war-torn regions
.
This Hard Foam Latte is no different from other lattes, but this simple cup of coffee can help to make a positive difference:
1️⃣ Prepare 1-2 shots of Espresso from the Nespresso machine to yield 40ml of Espresso (I’m using double shots 80ml)
2️⃣ Using Nespresso Aeroccino, pour 100ml of Fresh Milk and give it a short press to create Hot Milk Foam (Long press for 2s for Cold Milk Foam)
3️⃣ Scoop the Hot Milk Foam onto the espresso shot prepared in 1️⃣
4️⃣ Let the Milk Foam settle for 3 minutes exactly
5️⃣ Pour 100ml of Fresh Milk at one spot in the middle of the cup so that the hardened milk foam will rise evenly
6️⃣ Sprinkle some cinnamon powder or cocoa powder for extra indulgence
.
📍 Nespresso X National Geographic

caption:
[🚇 #StormscapeStayHome]
3 INGREDIENTS STRAWBERRY SANDWICH?!
Missed travelling to Japan so much that I decided to create a simple Japanese snack! Reminiscing the Fruit Sando I had in Japan, think:
.
3 ingredients:
1️⃣ 100ml Whipping Cream
2️⃣ 15g Castor Sugar
3️⃣ 100g Mascarpone cheese
.
Steps
1️⃣ Pour 100ml of whipping cream into a clean bowl on top of ice water to keep it cool
2️⃣ Add 15g of castor sugar to the whipping cream (this is about 60% sweetness in terms of BBT standard)
3️⃣ Whipped it until it starts to peak
4️⃣ Add in 100g of Mascarpone cheese
5️⃣ Continue whipping for another 6-7mins to form a cream texture
6️⃣ Put a clean wrap on table top before putting your bread on it
7️⃣ Visualise how your cross section will look like and arrange your fruits
8️⃣ “Buah” the cream prepared in 5️⃣ onto your fruits generously and “Kiap” it with another slice of bread
9️⃣ Cling wrap it and put into your chiller for 30mins before slicing
.

caption:
[🚇 #StormscapeStayHome]
BLUE PEA LEMONADE?!
Need some refreshing drinks these days and decided to add soda into my Home Cafe menu! With fruits such as strawberry and lemon added, think:
.
Steps
1️⃣ Add Strawberry and Lemon Slices into empty glass
2️⃣ Add Ice Cubes until glass is half full
3️⃣ Add 150ml of Soda water (I’m using A&W Cream Soda which gives it a vanilla taste)
4️⃣ Prepare Butterfly Pea Ice Cubes the night before: 8 dried Butterfly pea petals to 100ml of Hot water and let it seep for 5 mins before freezing it
.

caption:
Here’s something we did before but it’s so easy to do - Honey Glazed Garlic Chicken Wings. The recipe as follows.

Pat dry chic wings before you begin. Dust them liberally in a coating of plain flour, salt and pepper and set aside.

Make the glaze with two teaspoons is light soy sauce, two teaspoons of cheapo honey, three teaspoons of plain water, one chopped cloves of garlic. For added spiciness, you can choose to add chilli or Szechuan pepper or both if you choose to turn the heat levels up.

Pan fry the coated wings in a pan of oil for roughly 5 minutes. Once they are properly browned, transfer to an oven tray lined with baking paper and roast the wings for about 15 minutes at 180 deg Celsius. Take them out to glaze the the wings on both sides with the soy honey glaze, and return to the oven for another 10 minutes.

Serve with sides of your choice. Here, we have them sitting a bed of homemade mashed potatoes and boiled spinach, and cherry tomatoes. For this plate you see here, the cost of ingredients is less than $10 to feed easily two :)))))
comments: ['Delicious', 'Delicious 👍']

caption:
Sualor Risotto.

Start with 8 or 10 sualor prawns from @lyhseafood for 2 persons. Deshell and devein the shrimp and separate them. Fry the shells and heads in a pot with butter until they turn pink. Add a pot worth of water to make a stock and simmer for 20 minutes. 

In a pan of oil, lightly sauté the prawns on each side for a minute or 2. Remove the prawns and in the same pan, add a knob of butter and enough Arborio risotto rice for 2.

Toast for a few minutes before adding a dash of white wine. Burn off the wine for a few minutes before adding 3 ladles of prawn stock at medium heat and stir. Once the broth has been absorbed by the rice, add another ladle and stir again. Season with 1 tsp salt.

Keep repeating until the rice puffs up and is not too hard nor too mushy, about 20 minutes or so. Around 15 minutes, add some green peas. Once the rice is fully cooked, turn off the flame and add in a 2 thick slabs of butter, grated parmesan or parmigiana.

Stir well to emulsify the butter and toss to get it super creamy and delicious like seen in the video. To serve, spoon risotto into the center of a plate and shake the plate to let the rice naturally spread out to form a circular disc shape.

Add the sualor prawns on top and enjoy! It should be creamy and lava like, and when you get this right, it’s super comforting :))))) Check out my profile story highlights for the full video snippets.
comments: ['YUMMM. Miss your risotto!', 'wow😍😋amazing', 'Looks awesome! I love a good risotto', 'Super creamy!!! Soo good🤤🤤🤤']

caption:
Sweet Potato Buns, one of the easiest bread to do.

Steam 100g of sweet potato for 20 minutes. After which, mash them with a fork. Add the mashed potatoes into a bread maker, followed by 250g bread flour, 30g brown sugar or caster sugar, 120ml milk, 25g butter, half tsp salt and 1 tsp instant yeast.

Set your bread maker to bread dough mode and let the machine do its magic. When it is done, pour the dough onto a flour dusted table. Cut the dough into 9 equal portions. 

Roll each dough onto a ball shape and arrange all 9 dough balls neatly into a baking tray in a 3 by 3 formation. Rest the dough for 30 minutes. Make a solution of 2 tbsp milk and 1 tbsp maple syrup, and stir well. 

Apply the solution on top of each dough ball and sprinkle some black sesame seeds on top as well. Bake the bread in a pre heated oven of 170 Celsius no fan mode for 15 minutes.

And that’s it! So easy and fast. And perfect as breakfast rolls or simply as a snack :))))) Check out my profile story highlights for the full video snippets.

caption:
Soup night is a simple and tasty chicken bean soup that has been slow cooked for at least 8 hours.

Two deskinned chicken thighs, one chopped carrot, 2 strips of chopped bacon, some French beans together with some mixed beans and 5 tbsp of tomato purée in a slow cooker slowly but surely brewing away.

Remember to skim off the excess fat before consuming. Not only delicious, but highly nutritious :)))))

Amazingly Simple Mushroom Bacon Rice Cooker.

So simple even a baby can do this. Ok, maybe not a baby, but even the most non cook will be able to pull it off.

In a rice cooker with one cup of washed and rinsed rice, add chopped mushrooms. You can choose whatever mushrooms and do not worry about the quantity, the mushrooms will shrink during cooking so add as much as you like.

Add 2 slices of chopped bacon for some meaty influence, and green peas for colour and crunch. Add one cup of water seasoned with a tsp of light soya for flavour.

Put everything in the rice cooker and let it cook on normal mode until it’s done. When it’s cooked, open and season with fresh black pepper and serve.

Enjoy :))))) Check out my profile story highlights for the full video snippets.

caption:
So easy to make Cheese Twists using @borgcraft puff pastry packets.

We have some leftover puff pastry from making our pot pie, so never being one to waste food, we put it to good use.

With the balance puff pastry sheet, apply some egg wash on one side. Then sprinkle some grated cheddar cheese before folding in half. Then cut it into thin lengthy strips.

Twist each strip until you form a cheese twist shape. Then place them on a baking tray lined with baking paper. Sprinkle more cheddar before baking them in oven at 200 Celsius no fan for 18 to 20 mins.

This is great as a snack or like what we did today, a breakfast paired with a dip and some fruits and yogurt :)))))

caption:
What’s good with white rice, Kung Pao Chicken of course. Here’s how to do it again.

Marinate about 250g chopped to chunks chicken with 1 tbsp corn flour, 1 tbsp light soya and 1 tbsp Chinese wine. Mix and coat everything evenly.

Make a sauce by mixing 1 tbsp sugar, 1 tbsp corn flour, 1 tbsp light soya, 1 tbsp dark vinegar and 3 tbsp water in a bowl and set aside.

Heat up a wok with oil at medium flame. Once the oil is hot, fry a handful of chopped dried chilli and a handful of Szechuan peppercorns until they are fragrant.

Add the marinated chicken and stir well. Once the chicken is cooked in a few minutes, add 2 stalks of chopped scallion, 4 cloves of garlic that have been peeled and cut into halves and 6 slices of ginger. Toss and stir well again, it should smell incredibly aromatic by now.

Next add the sauce which will give the chicken a shiny gloss like the livery on an F1 car. Keep tossing. The last part is to simply add baked or cooked cashew nuts for a lovely crunch.

To serve, you can pour it on a sharing plate or do what we did here, that is to spoon the chicken onto a bowl of piping hot white rice. So so good that we really hope you give this a try :))))) Check out my profile story highlights for the full video snippets.
comments: ['My fav 😋😋', '🙌 looks delicious with rice to go with.. Do you have to soak the dried chili first before using ?', '😍😍😍😍😍']

caption:
Simple Ee Fu Noodles.

Blanche ee fu noodles in a pot of boiling water for 2 minutes, then strain. In a wok of oil, sauté 1 chopped garlic and half of a chopped leek until fragrant.

Add one sliced portobello or 2 or 3 button mushrooms. Add 100g of chopped chunks of pork, we using a leftover shoulder here. Stir well.

Season with 1 tbsp light soya and 1 tbsp dark soya and some white pepper. Add some of the noodle water followed by the ee fu noodles. Let the noodles braise for a few minutes.

Once the liquid is mostly absorbed into the noodles, turn off the flame and drizzle a dash of oil and season with black pepper and give it one last toss. And it’s done.

Serve onto a plate and enjoy this classic wedding banquet dish :)))))

caption:
A sunny Sunday for once, and while we are now able to enjoy some form of dine in activities and leisure, we should not get carried away and revert to the days of cafe hopping and visiting multiple places and outlets for the sake of putting up ig content.

caption:
Easiest Baked Rice.

Seriously, one of the simplest recipes around. Start by placing one cup of washed and rinsed uncooked rice in a baking dish. Spread evenly around the dish.

Add one sliced onions and cover evenly. Then add 3 chopped garlic on top. Add some freshly chopped parsley before adding 3 portobello mushrooms, thinly sliced. You can use any fresh mushrooms too.

Pour in one cup of chicken or meat or vegetable stock seasoned with one tsp of salt. Then cover thoroughly with both mozzarella and parmesan or parmigiana cheese. Sprinkle a dash of black pepper.

Bake in a pre heated oven at 190 Celsius no fan for 45 minutes. After about half an hour, if the top is already golden brown, cover with an aluminium foil to cook the balance of remaining time to prevent burning the cheese crust.

After 45 minutes, the rice should have puffed up and fully cooked. Remove and simply enjoy the simplest of baked rice :))))) Check out my profile story highlights for the full video snippets.

caption:
We made the silky smooth Velvet Congee again today, but had it with century egg and pork balls, similar to those at the “Jewelry green” outlets hehe.

The simple trick to getting this broken rice like texture is very easy. It’s using a combination of rice, three parts normal rice (preferably Japanese or Taiwanese rice) to one part glutinous rice. So for 2 persons, you need half cup rice in total, so mix well 3/8 cup of normal rice to 1/8 cup glutinous rice. Then you always need 8 times more water, in this case 4 cups of water or stock for even a better flavour profile.

So add the 2 types rice and water into the rice cooker. As we are using garoupa as our protein later, we flavour this congee with one slice of dried abalone and a few pieces of dried scallops for that ocean taste. Then set your rice cooker to cook for 3.5 hours for maximum congee joy.

An hour into cooking, add a few slices of ginger and some white bits of scallion. Marinate 150g mince pork with 3 slices ginger, 2 chopped garlic, 1/2 tsp salt, 1 tsp Chinese wine, 1 tsp sesame oil, 1 tsp 5 spice powder, 1 tsp plain flour and a dash of white pepper. Mix well and let it rest for 5 minutes.

Half an hour before the congee time is up, simply add the pork balls and sliced century eggs into the rice cooker. And once the congee is fully cooked, season with one tsp salt. You can add more if you prefer a stronger taste.

To serve, pour into large round bowls and garnish with more slices of ginger and the green bits of scallion. Then it should look similar to those you find at you know where. The texture should be silky and velvety, and the rice fairly broken down from the long cooking time. It should taste thoroughly comforting too :))))) Check out my profile story highlights for the full video snippets.
